DataElement.preferredName: Hyperthermia Cumulative Equivalent Minute Mean Temperature Duration Minute Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Minutes of duration for a hyperthermia thermal dose mean temperature reached on each treatment (CEM 43oCT50).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Hyperthermia Cumulative Equivalent Minute Mean Temperature
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Hyperthermia thermal dose mean temperature reached on each treatment (CEM 43oCT50).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A condition that manifests with abnormally high body temperature. In hyperthermic state, the hypothalamic set-point is normal but body temperature increases and overrides the ability to lose heat, resulting from exogenous heat exposure or endogenous heat production, e.g. in heat stroke, malignant hyperthermia, endocrine hyperthermia, or neuroleptic malignant syndrome. The concept does not refer to hyperpyrexia, the state when the hypothalamic set-point is reset at a higher temperature and is physiologically regulated.

Concepts.definition: A condition characterized by an abnormally high body temperature. In a hyperthermic state, the hypothalamic set-point is normal but body temperature increases and overrides the ability to lose heat, resulting from exogenous heat exposure or endogenous heat production.

Property.preferredDefinition: Increasing by successive addition.:A person or thing equal to another in value or measure or force or effect or significance etc; being essentially equal to something.:A unit measure of time equal to 60 seconds.:The sum of a set of values divided by the number of values in the set.:the degree of hotness or coldness of a body or environment.

Concepts.definition: A person or thing equal to another in value or measure or force or effect or significance etc.; being essentially equal to something.
A unit measure of time equal to 60 seconds.
The sum of a set of values divided by the number of values in the set.

A measure of the average kinetic energy of a system of particles. Temperature may be quantified, in the context of thermodynamics, as the potential of one system to transfer thermal energy to another system until both systems reach a state of thermal equilibrium.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Length or duration of an event or activity measured in minutes.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A unit measure of time equal to 60 seconds.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A unit measure of time equal to 60 seconds.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support Duke University adoption of C3D for ThermoDox trial.
